title: Can we make it so Ryze's snare cannot be chained onto you for 12 seconds.
body: I'm all for Ryze being viable, but when your getting all-inned at level 3 in your own minion wave, something has to change.

replies.body: We're working on some Ryze changes at the moment, aimed particularly at reducing his ability to chain root. Odds are that'll involve adjustments to CDs and damage numbers on his passive and basic spells, though we're still talking through the exact details.

I just hope Riot keeps in mind that damage is almost all Ryze has. I have changes going through testing that generally reduce the uptime and chain cast nature of Rune Prison, particularly in the early and mid game. The changes in testing (which should be announced soon) address the issue via a combination of tweaks to Rune Prison's duration when maxed, as well as the cadence at which it can be cast during the passive in the earlier parts of the game specifically. I'm pretty okay with him getting off two Rune Prison casts in the early part of the game during his passive, but the current 4-5 is just overkill at this point in the game. Additionally, by isolating any chain cast cases to later phases in the game, opponents should have more reasonable options against Ryze, whether that be grouping (getting help from allies), investing in tenacity, or just continuing to play around the windows his passive provides.

Just to put this out here... People who try to play a tanky Ryze will be disappointed in how little damage they will do even when permasnaring an enemy. In the Rework, Ryze's manaratios got a general nerf while his AP ratios got buffed. Simultaneously, he get's 30% CDR from his kit. People who still try to build Frozen Heart or Spirit Visage will find out that they've been wasting their Money for stats which aren't beneficial for Ryze. Why?

1. Tankyness: since Ryze has been nerfed to be reliant on his passive to provide him with a window to deal damage, you'll want to deal as much damage as you can. Since your sustained damage is really low after your passive times out the tankyness is worth nothing apart from maybe giving your other carries a bit more time to deal damage. It wont keep you alive for long enough to get your passive again.

2. CDR: Ryze's Kit gives him enough CDR, so wasted money here.

3. Mana: Probably the only beneficial stat together with the Spirit Visage passive, which can also still be of use for Ryze, but since the manascalings generally got nerfed and his AP ratios got buffed, building AP seems a lot more beneficial as an offensive stat for Ryze.

These are probably also the reasons for the pros not building tanky on Ryze and the winrate of Frozen Heart and Spirit Visage being average while the winrates of AP items like Luden's Echo and Rabadon's are going through the roof.
